result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert L Gould was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay $200.00 fine plus costs with appropriate surcharges ( Felony DNA Surcharge/Domestic Abuse Surcharge). If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Ashley Ridgeway

53 days jail credit (if probation revoked).
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Successfully complete Domestic Abuse Program and  Counseling recommended.
Successfully complete anger alternative treatment if available.
Continue mental health treatment as recommended by physician and take the prescription(s) as prescribed.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert L Gould in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Robert L Gould in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:20 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

State has provided victim notification but no victim's appear for today's sentencing.
Court indicates that there is a letter from the victim, Ashley Ridgeway  and all parties had received a copy.
Court and counsel have received their copies of the PSI.
Court questions if any correction need to be made on the record.

Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing.
Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing.
Defendant makes a brief statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Withhold sentence 
Placed on probation for 24 months
53 days jail credit (if probation revoked)
Pay $200.00 fine plus costs with appropriate surcharges ( Felony DNA Surcharge/Domestic Abuse Surcharge)
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Successfully complete Domestic Abuse Program and  Counseling recommended.
Successfully complete anger alternative treatment if available.
Continue mental health treatment as recommended by physician and take the prescription(s) as prescribed.
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Ashley Ridgeway 

Count 2 - DRI

**Atty McFarland will review the Appeal Rights of the Defendant
and Writ of Habeas Corpus

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing at 10-07-2015 11:00 am
from Victim

Defendant Robert L Gould in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Robert L Gould in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:23 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - Guilty
Count 2 - DRI

Court will not accept a No Contest Plea so defendant pleads guilty.
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 and Count 2 is DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.


BY THE COURT:
PSI Ordered
Bond is revoked
Sentencing Hearing to be heard within 60 days
and Writ of Habeas Corpus
